intro: Heteropterys eglandulosa var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glandless stems and heart-shaped, velvety leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and riverbanks.
